alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Eastern Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 4:29PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Montgomery, northwestern Philadelphia and northeastern Delaware Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 429 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Chestnut Hill, or near Philadelphia, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Norristown, West Norriton, East Norriton, Conshohocken, Ambler, Jenkintown, Narberth, Morris Park, Germantown, Bryn Mawr, Plymouth Meeting, Roxborough, Chestnut Hill, King Of Prussia, Willow Grove, Radnor Township, Horsham, Bridgeport and West Conshohocken. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 326 and 342. Northeast Extension between mile markers 21 and 22. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 327 and 342. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 13 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for southeastern Pennsylvania.
